alert.note: Alert for Edgefield; Newberry; Saluda (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued January 12 at 6:45PM EST until January 12 at 7:30PM EST by NWS Columbia
info.description: The National Weather Service in Columbia has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Newberry County in central South Carolina... North central Edgefield County in central South Carolina... Saluda County in central South Carolina... * Until 730 PM EST. * At 644 PM EST, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Joanna to 10 miles south of Ninety Six Historic Site, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. * Locations impacted include... Newberry, Saluda, Whitmire, Prosperity, Saluda County Airport, Newberry College, Newberry County Airport, Pomaria, Silverstreet, Saluda Co Sheriff`s Office, US-176 and SC- 34 Crossroads, Good Hope, Belfast Wildlife Management Area, Hollywood Elementary School, Emory, Chappells Fire Station, Delmar, Enoree Ranger District Office, Stoney Hill and Newberry County Detention Center. This includes Interstate 26 between mile markers 62 and 84. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EST for central South Carolina. For your protection seek shelter inside a sturdy building and stay away from windows. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EST for central South Carolina.
